column4: Should be a flashplayer.xpt and libflashplayer.so in there or you don't get Flash
I can actually watch Google Video!!  WooHoo! :)
Like some other service has a lock on the audio device
Heck, I don't know what kind of audio backend I'm using right now! :)
Ahh, the beautiful ignorance of just barely grasping what I'm using here :)
Still, for someone looking to learn Unix I think one of the BSD's is a good place to start.  Mostly because they don't provide the ease of use like Ubuntu does
Debian installation guide scared me away :)
I started moving away from Windows with RH 6.0... nice taste of things at the time, but I didn't really learn how to get around Unix
My fault, not red hat's
For whatever reason, I really dug BSD straight off
NetBSD is nice
I was thinking bum, but wasn't sure and didn't want to look much more dumb than I am :)
maybe cause automatix can install it
haven't used automatix, but I did read about it
its really great
with automatix i got my fully equippded desktop,including skype,java,opera and so on in just a few clicks
I'm sure I'll be looking at it at some point
try emacs ;)
hehe,but emacs is really a nice editor too
jde is a nice java ide
I've actually tried to like emacs, on a number of occassions.  My brain and those key strokes were never able to align
it just takes some time
i dont like vim
